reviews.text: They are the true definition of Japanese cuisine. The American roll was my favorite dishes including the duck roll which was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend this placeâ¤ï¸!

Had the best meal at Massaki tonight. We came on a Saturday night for dinner, 3 people.  We had reservations. As soon as we walked in they sat us down at our table. We ordered drinks first which came right away.  The waiters did a great job of bringing the food fast and gave us great suggestions on what to order. I got the sashimi dinner and tried a new roll with foie gras. It was the best roll I ever had and the sashimi was so fresh and delicious. I truly enjoyed the meal at this restaurant.

Just wow! If youâ€™re reading this review itâ€™s because you are looking to eat at a Japanese restaurant. Do yourself a favor and go! We ordered from the regular menu and there was absolutely nothing we didnâ€™t enjoy. The options were full of flavor and decent proportion. Perfect for any event. Date night, out with friends and kid-friendly.
Love the atmosphere. Very cozy and laid back. The staff was delightful and helpful.  Sushi was top notch

Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Definitely one of the best restaurants on bell blvd.
Bad service, hardly get any response, food is below average in my opinion, will not come back..

I came here for my Birthday and anniversary with my husband. We couldnâ€™t eat the beef in the Omakase set so Chef David curated something special for us. His heart, and effort is really special. I love coming here because of Chef David! Such warmth, skill and talent! Absolutely delicious and a wonderful experience.
ä¸ä»…ä»…å¯¿å¸ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªé±¼ä¹Ÿè›®å¥½åƒçš„ï¼Œç¯å¢ƒä¹Ÿä¸é”™
rude service

Food is really good and fresh.
Recommend to come.
Really like the grilled Eel.

very rude service and staff, the manager was especially very rude and not accommodating. we came in a few minutes past Omakase time and asked very nicely if they were able to accommodate us, and he very rudely told us no smiled with a very nasty smirk And when we said, why couldnâ€™t he be a little bit nicer? He replied with â€œyou just canâ€™t take no for an answer.â€ The most unprofessional manager, I have yet to see in the service industry.
If you want to have a great time with great food this is the spot for a casual date night
Michael's the best. Masaaki is the Greatest Sushi place in all of the 5 Boro's.

This elegant sushi spot is a true gem serving everything from ultra-fresh sashimi to creative Ã  la carte dishesâ€”all packed with authentic Japanese flavor. ğŸ£

The sashimi was incredibly fresh, but the pizza sushi completely stole the showâ€”crispy, flavorful, and unlike anything Iâ€™ve had before.

If you're craving top-tier sushi without the Manhattan crowds, this is your sign. Save this spotâ€”youâ€™ll thank me later. ğŸ˜‰ğŸ«¶

Absolutely blown away by this hidden gem in Bayside!
From the moment you walk in, the ambiance transports you straight to a quiet corner of Tokyo â€” warm lighting, minimalist decor, and an intimate chefâ€™s counter that sets the perfect mood for a true omakase experience.

Every dish was beautifully crafted and perfectly paced. The Toro Tartare was incredibly fresh and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, while the Miso Black Cod had that perfect balance of sweet and savory. The Foie Gras Roll? Pure indulgence.

Service was impeccable â€” attentive yet never intrusive, and the chef took time to explain the inspiration behind each course. You can really feel the passion and precision in every bite.

If youâ€™re looking for high-quality Japanese cuisine with artistry and soul â€” this place is a must.
A true Art of Omakase experience. Will definitely return soon!
Food was fantastic. So beautifully displayed. The restaurant was chic and classy. Staff was very pleasant. Making plans to go back with others who will enjoy the restaurant.

Went for dinner and ordered the prefix menu for the restaurant week.
The appetizer was amazing.
Ordered sushi and sashimi entre, which was good.
Also Ordered Maki set entre, which was a huge disappointment. Definitely not worth for $60!!
Dessert was good.
Will I return? ğŸ¤”
Staff needs more training on explaining those chefs specials. It was not impressive overall.

If you're looking for a must try dining experience, Masaaki is the place to be. (Especially if youâ€™re from the areaâ€¦good lunch deals). As soon as I stepped in, I was greeted by beautiful hand-painted artwork that covered the walls. I have tried both their Omakase and their regular menu items + cocktails.

I was had the 15-course meal. (Heard the Omakase chef went to culinary school in Japan). Each course was art, beautifully presentedâ€¦great flavor. The fish was fresh, some of the best I have ever tried. They have limited reservations available for Omakase, but this experience is definitely worth the splurge.

I went back to try out their regular menu, and it is just as delicious. Generous portions. Try the Lobster Bisque

Definitely a regular here now.
**Great sushi spot!** The fish was incredibly fresh, and the rolls were perfectly made. Friendly service and cozy atmosphereâ€”will definitely be back!

We absolutely love this place. The omakase is probably some of the best I have ever had. The sushi is incredible and the atmosphere is wonderful. We joke that this is our little piece of Manhattan in bayside.
Best sushi in Flushing/Bayside . Everytime amazing sushi , always consistent . Been ordering for over a year, never disappointed. Always looking forward to the next order !
èœå“å¥½å¥½åƒï¼Œåå¢ƒå¥½èˆ’æœ

Loved the Sweet Heart Roll â€” such a creative and delicious sushi! The fish was super fresh, and the atmosphere was cozy and perfect for date nights or hanging out with friends. Great service and convenient parking nearby. Highly recommend checking it out if youâ€™re in Bayside!
Delicious ğŸ¤¤

Great spot for some real Japanese cuisine.
Super friendly staff, always checking up on you.
Nice size location with a nice sized bar. Drinks and cocktails are in full display.

The food is top notch. Your rolls and sushi are being created for you, right in front of you. The station is visible to everyone and itâ€™s great to see your food being built out.

A definite must â€œstop on inâ€ in Queens.

Enjoyed the yaki oysters, sashimi platter, and trio sushi dinner. My friends enjoyed the tuna dinner, tempura udon soup, and ocean roll. Love the ambiance of this restaurant which is great for small and big groups. The servers are also so nice.
I got food poisoned after eating their omakase
Great place and great service
The sushi is absolutely worth the visit. The Omakasi deal is super worth the deal and will definitely be coming back with more friends!
Delicious and fresh food.

We were there for the first time. My son spent one year in Japan and fell in love with the food. It was my birthday. The food were delicious & the server was good. I would definitely return & recommend others.
Great food and ambience! Very friendly staff. Iâ€™ve been here multiple times and itâ€™s my go to whenever Iâ€™m in the area. I love the sea bass and omakase is great too :)

The place is a nice looking place but when I spend $30 for a special sushi roll I expect a decent size the size of the roll was the same size if you will order a regular room. Usually other places that are top-notch charge the most 18.00 to 20.00 dollars a roll. The sushi roll have good flavor but I think they overcharged you.
Great food and atmosphere

Masa Omakase â€“ A Rare Culinary Experience

Masaâ€™s omakase is an experience in a category of its own. While many are familiar with the more casual Ã  la carte section of Masaâ€”perfect for a relaxed sushi biteâ€”the omakase offering is an entirely different world.

Here, you have the rare opportunity to witness Chef Masa Takayama himself at work. Itâ€™s intimate, precise, and deeply personal. Be prepared: this is not a light evening. The meal alone can run a few thousand dollars, not including pairingsâ€”and the portions are generous. Iâ€™d recommend arriving with an appetite; I made the mistake of eating earlier and couldnâ€™t finish all the beautifully crafted dishes.

What stood out was the chefâ€™s attentivenessâ€”he noticed my pace and subtly adjusted the portion sizes to match my intake. That kind of detail and awareness is rare.

This isnâ€™t just a mealâ€”itâ€™s a masterclass in flavor, form, and reverence for tradition. If you have the chance, experience it while Chef Takayama is still with us. Itâ€™s a true honor.
Food is delicious. Decor is warm and inviting. Staff is always so nice and attentive. Great spot for dates or to go with your girlfriends!
Great spot and service
Excellent food, drinks and excellent service and consistent every time The go to sushi place in Bayside
ìŒì‹ ë§›ì´ ë„ˆë¬´ì—†ë‹¤. ìŠ¤ì‹œì™€ íŠ€ê¹€ì€ ë„ˆë¬´ í‰ë²”í–ˆê³ , ìš°ë™ì€ ì†ì„ ëŒ€ì§€ë„ ì•Šì•˜ë‹¤.

Masaaki â€“ Your Next Sushi Spot in Bayside! ğŸ£ğŸ”¥

If youâ€™re into Japanese food, Masaaki in Bayside is a must-try! This place is huge, but still cozy with a modern vibeâ€”perfect for a chill dinner or a special night out.

The food? So good. The sashimi platter is super fresh, the crispy rice tuna is packed with flavor, and the miso black cod is just chefâ€™s kiss. They even have ramen, which hits perfectly on a cold day. ğŸœ

With a full bar, extensive menu, and solid prices, itâ€™s no surprise this spot stays busy. Definitely worth coming back for! Whoâ€™s down for sushi? Tag your crew! â¬‡ï¸

We had an incredible omakase experience at Masaaki! The atmosphere was warm and inviting, and the chef and staff were exceptionally welcoming. Every dish was beautifully prepared and incredibly fresh. Weâ€™ll definitely be back for more!

I dined here for an Omakase recently and loved every moment of it. The serving staff were super attentive. The chefs were so talented and incredibly friendly. They chit chatted with the diners and genuinely cared what we thought of the food. All of it tasted phenomenal. I regret not upgrading my omakase experience because the dishes I missed out on looked great too.
Will return again very soon.

A modern Japanese gem in Bayside! Masaaki offers high quality sashimi, sushi, rolls, izakaya plates, and even omakase. Their menu is EXTENSIVE. Make sure to get their sashimi platter and rolls. They use premium raw fish that is fresh, fatty, and incredibly buttery.

The restaurant is clean and spacious, perfect for group gatherings or a cozy date night.

ï¼ŠSashimi Deluxe $38 ***
The deluxe set consists of six assorted sashimi, including toro, salmon, yellowtail, and white fish. Every piece was fresh, fatty, and melt-in-your-mouth buttery. I loved the refreshing flavor and complex textures when I ate the sashimi with shiso leaf and shredded radish in a mouthful.

ï¼ŠSalmon Tartare $19.5 **
100% recommend this sushi starter! You can pick salmon/tuna/toro as your raw fish topping. It was beautifully garnished with flowers and fish roe, drizzled in a yuzu ponzu sauce. The diced avocado was creamy and the citrusy note enhanced the depth of flavors.

ï¼ŠSweet Heart Roll $21 *
They have a wide selection of creative rolls. These heart-shaped rolls were not only pretty but also delicious. Tuna fans would love this roll.

ï¼ŠRainbow Roll $19
You can never go wrong with this classic roll combo: topped with salmon, tuna, white fish and avocado, and filled with crabmeat and cucumber

ï¼ŠChicken Yakitori $12
Saucy and smoky. The chicken breast was delicious with green pepper and onion.

Went to Masaaki for happy hour on a Monday and it was great! They have food and drink specials starting at 4:30 pm. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. They have a good selection of Japanese beer on tap and the sushi was fresh. You also get a complimentary plate of edamame to snack on.

Letâ€™s start with the atmosphere. The place is spacious, nicely designed, and has a somewhat fancy vibe.

We ordered a variety of sushi, sashimi, and appetizers. The tempura was excellent, but the sushi and sashimi were just average in quality. For the price, we expected better. The selection was nearly identical to what we typically get from another nearby sushi spot at a much lower cost. For us, it simply wasnâ€™t worth the premium price, so weâ€™ll be sticking to our regular spot in the future.

On a positive note, the service was good.

Nicely detailed indoor, spacious, and elegant. Delicious food is always beautifully served. Great atmosphere, good place for a date or anniversary dinner. Staff is very friendly and takes good care of the customers. Highly recommended.

Excellent Service and almost perfect food.  Went for the  Valentineâ€™s Day Omakase menuâ€¦ delicious food.. 16 course service that includes champagnes and a rose for my wife.  The only disappointment was the dessertâ€¦ was not up to par with the rest of the omakaseâ€¦

Lovely interior. Surprised at how large it was. Many private areas and smaller rooms for private affairs. Lobster avacado dish was very good. Grilled eel over fried rice was delicious. The sashimi platter was very fresh and tasty. Miso cod, vegetable tempura, and tofu teriyaki were all good. My glass of Chardonnay was very good. Great service. I recommend this restaurant!

For those of you who are looking for an authentic Japanese restaurant, this is for sure, not it. But if you are used to visiting Chinese owned Japanese restaurants, and are fine with their style/food, this place is very big and have a pretty good overall ambience. If you pay them cash, you get 5% discount.

I made a last min same day omakase reservation and was able to get 2 seats. For a 5pm seating, we were seated at around 5:07pm. The group (everyone in that seating) was brought to the counter table which was at the back of restaurant. However the space is not entirely â€œprivateâ€ for the counter seats, we were surrounded by other tables with large parties, and sometimes it can be loud. As we arrived at the counter, all of us just pretty much â€œpicked our seatsâ€ instead of being brought to our specific seats like how Japanese omakase places would do.

Not long after being seated, we were asked if we wanted to order any drinks without being asked if we wanted water or hot tea. I asked for hot tea and appreciated that it was an option. Then appetisers were served - all 3 of them were prepared at the wrong temperature, fish pieces were served too cold and overpowered with truffle oil and sesame sauce. The oyster piece was fine. The black miso cod was too salty and the chawan mushi was not smooth. We thought this dinner is ruined.

Then the nigiri pieces were served. The first few pieces were fine, giving us some hope. They then started to sear a couple of fatty pieces and added very random toppings like very strong cheese over the king salmon. The tuna roll had too much pickles over tuna. And thereâ€™s just too much on a plate for the last plate with wagyu, uni, caviar, kinpaku, truffle, shiso flowersâ€¦

So perhaps this suits some diners, over decorated nigiri pieces, seared fatty pieces etc. Just not if you are looking for authentic Japanese omakase.

The food was delicious, the lobster soup is great and so was the roasted eel Kamameshi rice. The dumplings were so good too! Not to mention the interior of the restaurant is so beautiful! Everything is so clean and so aesthetically beautiful. The service was good too, no complaints. This restaurant definitely puts effort into everything, down to the bags they give for leftovers. A gem!

Great price for omakase, after taxes and tips was 180 ish for 18 courses. All the servers were polite and nice. The atmosphere was ehh, we came with 12 people so we thought it will be more private but they also have regular dinner tables set up in the same room as omakase. Other than that everything was fresh and a very decent price for what I was
served.

Amazing experience at Masaaki! Our friends recommended this place before! Definitely will come back! You can park the car at the parking lot ($2 for one hour) or street parking. They also have omakaseï¼Œ cheaper than Manhattan. Please try the Rock shrimp tempura! Also try roasted Eel rice, soooooo good!

Convenient location! Just next to parking lot.

Savor the artistry of sushi in our serene Japanese eatery. Each delicately handcrafted roll is a symphony of flavors, combining fresh fish, crisp vegetables, and perfectly seasoned rice. The ambiance hums with gentle conversation and the rhythmic clink of chopsticks. Indulge in an experience where every bite tells a story of culinary mastery.

Beautiful place off the main drag. Sushi is very good. Staff is efficient and accommodating. They clean their beer taps frequently!! Really exceptional lunch special - at a great value.

Don't hesitate.

OMAKASE REVIEW: If youâ€™re looking for a casual, comfortable place to get omakase in the bayside area, this is the place you want to be at. The quality of the fish and the creativeness of the pieces was an unexpected delight! We werenâ€™t expecting a Manhattan style omakase, but from the first dish, we already knew we walked into one of the best omakases in queens.

10/10 would recommend! The chef was also super informative and enjoyable to dine with!
Price: $138 for 18 course omakase but there is a 15 course option for $98!

Iâ€™ve been coming since their very first opening day almost 2 years ago. They have grown a lot and made some great improvements along the way.

The menu has some excellent variety and the prices are reasonable for the area. It would be nice though if the servers were more pleasant.. they almost always seem like they are just counting down the hours until they can get out. If you watch them interact with other tables you can really see it. The bus boy is always super friendly. Give that kid a server position!

Anyway, this is a full update of my previous review. Good job with all the changes and I look forward to my next visit.

When I enter a sushi restaurant, I know it is authentic Japanese because the sushi chefs will greet every guest who enters aloud in Japanese. That won't happen at Masaaki, because the chefs & staff are Chinese. FYI for those who are ignorant of Japanese custom. Keeping an open mind, I ordered tempura and sushi & sashimi lunch. The presentation and quality of raw fish were very good. Tempura was deep fried to perfection. No shortcuts with size of fish. Portion was very generous, especially for lunch. Interior is very clean & contemporary Japanese decor. Premium feel & quality come with premium price. However, as I already mentioned, the portion is generous. Service was adequate. Why not 5 stars? There was no bar seating in front of sushi chefs. I love to sit at a sushi bar to see the artistry & skill of a top sushi chef in real time. Oftentimes, some great conversations happen with them. The other reason is the fact I mentioned earlier. When I dine at a Szechuan house, I expect Chinese chefs & staff. I wouldn't want Koreans running the place. Likewise, a Japanese omakase should be run by Japanese people. To be very clear, this is a topic of race, culture, tradition & authenticity and not to be misunderstood as a racist comment. True foodies will understand. In any case, I recommend Masaaki, which is located in a quaint, cozy side street from the main stretch of the heart of Bayside restaurant district. Support your local small businesses & restaurants ğŸ‘

The omakase experience was amazing! This was my 2nd time here within one month (omakase only), and it will not be my last! My pictures are a combo of both experiences. I may have missed some courses because everything was delicious lol. The Chefs are knowledgeable and cooked with love. They take the time out to answer any questions you may have. The waiters are attentive and accommodating. The ingredients are fresh and everything just melts in your mouth.

4.5/5 stars

It's my first time at omakase. I ate everything, even trying my first raw oyster. I loved each of the bites excluding the uni and the red bean dessert. I think the scallop bite was my favorite! Lots of truffle incorporated which I absolutely adore. We did the 19 course tasting menu.

In addition, they have valet that I believe is comped, and Thursday through Saturday nights they have beer, wine, and sake, buy one get one free. That was a nice treat!

Would come again!

Fabulous dining experience. Chic atmosphere with an upscale Japanese decor.

Friendly and efficient wait staff.

The miso glazed black cod was superb. Food presentations were next level great.

Wow The food is absolutely exquisite! Mouth watering, cooked to perfection in taste and consistency. It is so good it's like food candy! The service is outstanding and the ambience creates an almost spa like atmosphere. That is an A+ while eating food that is so good you wish to savor!!! The prices vary and for what you get, it is quite worth it!!!
EXCELLENT!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

A surprisingly high-quality sushi spot in Bayside! Sashimi is incredibly fresh and the rolls are great (the special rolls are worth the extra price, as they have some unique combinations). The decor and ambiance make it ideal for a date or quiet meal, and service is attentive. Definitely an excellent Japanese spot worth visiting!

Came here for dinner with friends family, this place is modern and the service is pretty good.
Ordered sashimi deluxe, Chilean sea bass with truffle sauces, tofu tempura dinner, rock shrimps appetizers and teriyaki chicken with rice and few rolls!  All the seafood are fresh and decent portions! Will visit again next time.
